qas.question: What area of Houston hosts performing arts?
Of what is Houston second in performing arts?
To what type of arts is Houston home?
To what group is Jones Hall home?
Besides Jones Hall, what other organization is housed in the Theater District?

answers.text: Hobby Center for the Performing Arts

qas.question: What area of Houston hosts visual arts?
Of what is Houston fourth in performing arts?
To what type of arts is Texas home?
What company is Jones Hall owned by?

plausible_answers.text: Hobby Center for the Performing Arts

qas.question: Besides Jones Hall, what other organization is housed in the Movie District?

context: The <a0_0><b5_0>Houston Theater District<b5_0/><a0_0/>, located downtown, is home to nine major performing arts organizations and six performance halls. It is the second-largest concentration of <a1_0><b6_0>theater seats<b6_0/><a1_0/> in a downtown area in the United States. Houston is one of few United States cities with permanent, professional, resident companies in <b7_0>all <a2_0>major performing<b7_0/> arts<a2_0/> disciplines: opera (Houston Grand Opera), ballet (Houston Ballet), music (<b8_0>Houston Symphony Orchestra<b8_0/>), and theater (The Alley Theatre). Houston is also home to folk artists, art groups and various small progressive arts organizations. Houston attracts many touring Broadway acts, concerts, shows, and exhibitions for a variety of interests. Facilities in the Theater District include the Jones Hall—home of the <a3_0>Houston Symphony Orchestra<a3_0/> and Society for the Performing Arts—and the <a4_0><b9_0>Hobby Center for the Performing Arts<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
